author: lgo
msg: Fix NTLM authentication of pipelined requests:
- Set up and keep status of NTLM authentication for the first request, ignore
failing authentication for all other requests in the pipeline.
- Add a new callback mechanism that enables per authentication protocol
setting of the authentication headers of a serf_request_t object.
For basic authentication we copy the same authentication header for each
request on one connection. For NTLM this is not possible, as the server does
not accept multiple requests having a NTLM challenge header.
* subversion/libsvn_ra_serf/ra_serf.h
(svn_serf__setup_request_func_t): new function typedef.
(serf_auth_protocol_t): add setup_request_func callback function.
* subversion/libsvn_ra_serf/auth.c
(serf_auth_protocols): define callbacks for Basic and NTLM authentication.
(setup_request_basic_auth): new function.
* subversion/libsvn_ra_serf/win32_auth_sspi.h
(enum sspi_auth_state, serf_sspi_context_t): store the progress of NTLM
authentication for this connection.
(setup_request_sspi_auth): new function.
* subversion/libsvn_ra_serf/win32_auth_sspi.c
(init_sspi_connection): initializes state of NTLM authentication.
(handle_sspi_auth): ignore 401 when NTLM authentication has started. No
need to store the Authentication header in the session here, we can't
reuse it anyway.
(setup_request_sspi_auth): new function. Add the authentication headers to
only one request. Since they're stored in the connection object we need
to delete them after we copied them in the request.
(sspi_get_credentials): store progress of authentication.
* subversion/libsvn_ra_serf/propfind_buckets.c
(become_request): invoke the setup_request authentication callback when
creating a new serf_request_t object.
* subversion/libsvn_ra_serf/util.c
(svn_ra_serf__setup_serf_req): idem

author: lgo
msg: Extract the code to create the authentication header in a separate function.
* subversion/libsvn_ra_serf/ra_serf.h
(encode_auth_header): declare new function
* subversion/libsvn_ra_serf/auth.c
(encode_auth_header): new function, base64 encodes the authentication data
and builds a new authentication header with it.
(handle_basic_auth): use encode_auth_header.
* subversion/libsvn_ra_serf/win32_auth_sspi.c
(handle_sspi_auth): use encode_auth_header.

author: dustin
msg: Move the post-merge merge_props and blocked_props update to *before*
the generation of the commit message. This allows a CTRL+C interrupt
to break the generation of the commit message, without leaving the
working copy in an inconsistent state. Requested by Giovanni Bajo.
* contrib/client-side/svnmerge.py:
(action_merge): Move the commit log generation to the end of the
method.
Patch by:  Raman Gupta <rocketraman@fastmail.fm>
Review by: Giovanni Bajo <rasky@develer.com>

author: dustin
msg: Prevent spurious conflicts on the merge and blocked property
when the source branch contains merge property information for
other branches i.e. a transitive merge A -> B -> C is executed.
Previously, this caused a property conflict because the initial
value on the source branch did not match the initial value on
the target branch.
This patch also prevents extra merge property information from
uninitialized branches being merged into the target. If merging
to those other branches was never initialized on the target by
the user, then the user probably does not expect to see that
information. Note that if that information *was* initialized by
the user, then the user is attempting to do graph-based merging
i.e. A -> B -> C -> A which is currently unsupported.
* contrib/client-side/svnmerge_test.py
(testTransitiveMerge): test a transitive merge
* contrib/client-side/svnmerge.py:
(action_merge): Before each merge, clear the integrated/blocked
properties. Reset these properties to known values after the
merge is complete.
Patch by:  Raman Gupta <rocketraman@fastmail.fm>
Dustin J. Mitchell <dustin@zmanda.com>
Review by: Giovanni Bajo <rasky@develer.com>

author: lgo
msg: Small code improvement: calculate the length of the token (authentication
header) for NTLM instead of using a fixed value.
* subversion/libsvn_ra_serf/win32_auth_sspi.c
(global): new static variable to hold the max. token size for NTLM
(sspi_maxtokensize): use the SSPI functions to calculate the maximum
token size
(sspi_get_credentials): used the calculated size instead of fixed value.
